translation.en: [man] Sure, there are mutants and mages galore,
but the slow, beating heart of The Witcher is in its monsters.
translation.ko: 사실 '위쳐'의 심장은 괴물이라고 할 수 있죠

translation.en: While some may be unfamiliar to you,
they've actually been with us, stalking through human stories,
translation.ko: 오래전부터 이야기를 통해 인간과 함께한 존재들입니다

translation.en: for centuries, even millennia.
Here are the very real mythologies behind every single monster
translation.ko: '위쳐'의 첫 번째 시즌 전반부에 등장하는 모든 괴물과

translation.en: in the first half of The Witcher's first season, in order of appearance.
translation.ko: 그 유래가 된 실제 신화들을 순서대로 소개해 드립니다

translation.en: Okay, so you know The Witcher is serious about monsters
translation.ko: 첫 장면에 키키모라가 등장한 순간 "라틴명: 피토니삼 도메스티쿠스 서식지: 집, 습지"

translation.en: when it has a kikimora in the first scene of the first episode.
translation.ko: "라틴명: 피토니삼 도메스티쿠스 서식지: 집, 습지" 괴물에 진심이라는 걸 눈치채셨을 겁니다

translation.en: If that name's not ringing a bell,
it's probably because it's a beast from Slavic folklore,
translation.ko: 슬라브 설화 속 괴물이라서 그럴 거예요 "서슬라브, 동슬라브 남슬라브"

translation.en: which has been underrepresented in popular fiction.
translation.ko: "서슬라브, 동슬라브 남슬라브" 대중 문학에서는 많이 다루어지지 않았죠

translation.en: To start, kikimoras are always female.
translation.ko: 먼저, 키키모라는 전부 암컷입니다 주로 분만 중 사망한 여성이나 사산아로부터 탄생하며

translation.en: They rise from stillborn children, or women who died in labor,
translation.ko: 주로 분만 중 사망한 여성이나 사산아로부터 탄생하며

translation.en: and often bear the deceased's face.
In some Russian versions of the tale,
kikimora is, indeed, a creature of the swamp,
who leaves wet footprints wherever she goes.
translation.ko: 발이 닿는 곳마다 젖은 발자국을 남긴다고 하지만

translation.en: But in most, she's a purely household spirit,
translation.ko: "환영합니다" 대부분의 키키모라는 집에서 찾아볼 수 있습니다

translation.en: occasionally, a nightmarish household spirit,
slipping through keyholes to squat on the chest of sleepers, suffocating them.
translation.ko: 열쇠 구멍을 비집고 들어가 자는 사람을 깔고 앉아 질식시킨다고 하죠

translation.en: In her more benign incarnations, though,
she's described as more of a nuisance with a cleanliness fetish.
So you can think of kikimora
as kind of a monstrous cousin to… Marie Kondo?
translation.ko: 곤도 마리에의 괴물 사촌이라고 봐도 되겠네요?

translation.en: I love mess.
Human-animal hybrids are a…
♪ Tale as old as time ♪
Almost every mythological tradition on Earth has some variation of them.
translation.ko: 지구상 모든 문화권에는 어떤 식으로든 혼종이 등장합니다

translation.en: The first we see in The Witcher are sylvans,
which resemble fawns,
the unpredictable woodland man-goats from Greco-Roman mythology.
translation.ko: 판은 염소 인간의 모습을 한 숲의 신으로 그리스 로마 신화에 나옵니다

translation.en: In many versions of that latter myth, the Minotaur was conceived
when the insulted god Poseidon took revenge on the insulting King Minos
translation.ko: 신 포세이돈은 미노스왕에게 모욕을 당하자 왕에게 복수하기 위해

translation.en: by cursing his wife,
making her fall for a real specimen of a bull.
translation.ko: 황소와 사랑에 빠진 왕비가 미노타우로스를 낳았다고 합니다

translation.en: There's a lot of art on the Internet about this. [sighs]
It might be why Geralt goes immediately for the mom insults.
translation.ko: 게롤트가 바로 엄마를 언급한 것도 이런 이유 때문일 거예요

translation.en: Your mother fuck a goat?
But lest you think that human-animal hybrids
are just ancient magical things,
allow me to introduce you to the mysterious Pig-Faced Lady of Europe.
translation.ko: 유럽의 돼지 머리 여자에 관한 알쏭달쏭한 이야기를 들려줄게요

translation.en: Nearly simultaneously in the 1600s, in multiple places across the continent,
translation.ko: 1600년대, 유럽 대륙 전반에서는 동시다발적으로 같은 전설이 생겨났습니다

translation.en: a legend arose of a pregnant rich woman who was cursed,
translation.ko: 동시다발적으로 같은 전설이 생겨났습니다 저주받은 부유한 여성이 임신한 후

translation.en: and whose baby was born with a pig's head.
The myth persisted, and somehow gained the veneer of fact.
translation.ko: 전설은 계속 퍼지면서 실화라는 과장이 보태졌고

translation.en: As late as the 1800s, newspapers reported
that the Pig-Faced Lady lived in London's posh Manchester Square.
translation.ko: 부촌인 런던 맨체스터 광장에서 살고 있다는 기사도 나왔답니다

translation.en: If you finished The Witcher,
you know the striga is probably the scariest monster on the show,
translation.ko: 시리즈에서 가장 무서운 괴물이 스트리가라는 걸 아실 겁니다

translation.en: although technically, she's a cursed human.
And that's fitting, because they're pretty terrifying
translation.ko: 여기엔 이유가 있습니다 얼마 없는 신화 속에서도 무시무시하게 묘사되고 있거든요

translation.en: in the scant myths about them too.
translation.ko: 얼마 없는 신화 속에서도 무시무시하게 묘사되고 있거든요

translation.en: According to what we have, the striga is sort of a vampire prototype.
translation.ko: 주어진 자료에 의하면 스트리가는 흡혈귀의 원형으로 보입니다

translation.en: Huge, almost bird-like claws, sharp fangs, and a thirst for human flesh and blood,
translation.ko: 거대한 날짐승의 발톱 날카로운 이빨 그리고 인간의 살과 피를 먹지만 동물을 섭취하기도 하죠

translation.en: -although she can live off of animals too. -[wailing]
translation.ko: 그리고 인간의 살과 피를 먹지만 동물을 섭취하기도 하죠

translation.en: But strigas weren't born that way.
The unlucky number was two.
People with two hearts, two souls, two sets of teeth,
translation.ko: 두 개의 심장, 두 개의 영혼 두 명의 치아가 있어야 해요

translation.en: conditions common when a pregnant woman was cursed,
could become strigas after they died.
Their second self sort of took over the corpse
translation.ko: 두 번째 영혼이 시체의 주인이 되면서

translation.en: and went on a feeding frenzy.
Even though they're not so common in fiction,
it's interesting how many cultures have variations on the theme.
translation.ko: 꽤 많은 문화권에서 비슷한 이야기가 등장합니다

translation.en: Striga's demonic cousins proliferated across Southern and Eastern Europe
translation.ko: 스트리가의 사촌뻘 변형은 유럽 남부와 동부에 많이 있는데

translation.en: to unlikely places, like your garden.
This is the striga, or witchweed plant, which is kind of pretty, right?
translation.ko: 스트리가, 또는 위치위드라고 부르는 꽃이에요 꽤 예쁘게 생기지 않았나요?

translation.en: But it's known for viciously penetrating the roots of a host plant
translation.ko: 그러나 살벌하게도 숙주 식물의 뿌리에 침투해

translation.en: and sucking out all of its nutrients.
Scientists even make dad jokes about its rapaciousness.
translation.ko: "유능한 곡물 킬러 스트리가의 특징" 과학자들도 그 식탐에 놀라 농담을 던질 정도죠

translation.en: So whether it's the plant or the bewitched princess variety,
translation.ko: 그러니 식물이든 저주에 걸린 공주든 간에

translation.en: -stay away from strigas, y'all. -[squealing]
Well, when it comes to episode four's selkiemaw,
the showrunners of The Witcher didn't give us much info to work with.
Thanks, Lauren Schmidt Hissrich!
All we hear is a pretty gripping tavern talk
translation.ko: 우리에게 주어진 단서는 한 마을 주민이

translation.en: from a villager that includes the creature's name.
The ice cracked open
and a selkiemaw shot out!
Oh, you never seen one!
And all we see are its guts on Geralt.
Had to kill it from the inside.
The name "selkiemaw" in every spelling we could think of
translation.ko: 철자를 바꿔서 검색해 봐도 아무것도 나오지 않습니다

translation.en: doesn't return any results.
translation.ko: 철자를 바꿔서 검색해 봐도 아무것도 나오지 않습니다 "셀키 모를 찾으셨나요?"

translation.en: But plain old selkies are indeed notable mythological creatures of the water.
translation.ko: "셀키" 하지만 '셀키'라는 이름은 물속 요정으로 널리 알려져 있죠

translation.en: In Irish, Scottish, and Icelandic folklore,
the selkie is kind of an affable, shape-shifting seal.
translation.ko: 모습을 바꿀 수 있는 친근한 바다표범으로 묘사됩니다

translation.en: It mostly spends its time in seal-like endeavors,
lounging on rocks, being cute, et cetera,
but occasionally, it sheds its prized skin,
revealing a beautiful human underneath, and comes ashore.
translation.ko: 아름다운 인간의 형태로 변신해 뭍으로 올라오죠

translation.en: There's usually a lot of marriage shenanigans after this.
translation.ko: 그 후에는 결혼을 한다든가 그런 이야기가 나옵니다

translation.en: Its use is fitting for an episode writen by an Irishman.
translation.ko: 그래서 아일랜드 작가가 에피소드를 맡았던 걸까요? "각본: 데클런 더 바라"

translation.en: Still, a friendly seal with magical outerwear
translation.ko: 하지만 마법의 가죽을 가진 친근한 바다표범은

translation.en: doesn't quite square with what little we know of the selkiemaw.
translation.ko: 몇 개 없는 셀키모어의 특징에 잘 들어맞지 않습니다 위쳐를 통째로 삼킬 수 있으며

translation.en: Like, it can swallow a witcher whole.
It has swallowed a whole village… whole.
It possesses a cavernous mouth with devil's teeth.
translation.ko: 악마 같은 이로 가득한 입을 동굴처럼 벌린다고 하잖아요

translation.en: And actually, there is tell of a similar creature
translation.ko: 이 말에 어울리는 괴물이 나타났다는 이야기가

translation.en: lurking deep within Russia,
about a six hours' drive west of Moscow.
The Brosno Dragon.
It's said to be a huge reptilian or dinosaur-like creature
translation.ko: 거대한 파충류 혹은 공룡처럼 생겼다고 하며

translation.en: that inhabits the small, but curiously deep waters of Lake Brosno.
translation.ko: 면적은 작지만 매우 깊은 브로스노 호수에 산다고 해요

translation.en: And just like the selkiemaw, the dragon can eat.
translation.ko: 그리고 셀키모어처럼 이 용도 식성이 좋습니다

translation.en: His stories are full of him chomping down on things
translation.ko: 이 녀석이 나타날 때마다 뭔가가 한입에 삼켜지곤 하죠

translation.en: like invading Tatar warriors and their horses,
translation.ko: 러시아를 침략한 타타르 전사와 말도 삼키고

translation.en: a German aeroplane during World War II,
translation.ko: 세계 2차 대전 중 독일 전투기도 삼키고

translation.en: and, somehow, an entire island
translation.ko: 어떻게 했는지는 몰라도 바이킹들이 보물을 남겨둔 섬도 어김없이 삼켜버립니다

translation.en: that some Vikings were going to leave some treasure on.
translation.ko: 바이킹들이 보물을 남겨둔 섬도 어김없이 삼켜버립니다

translation.en: I don't know if this is wise without a witcher in tow,
translation.ko: 위쳐 없이 용을 찾는 건 무모한 행동 같지만

translation.en: but people still look for the dragon.
This is an easily-chompable dog sled team searching across the frozen lake.
translation.ko: 한 입 거리인 개 썰매 팀이 얼어붙은 호수를 수색 중이네요

translation.en: ♪ Toss a coin to your witcher ♪
♪ O, Valley of Plenty ♪
♪ Whoa-oh-oh ♪
Our search for the selkiemaw, however, has reached its successful conclusion.
translation.ko: 셀키모어의 정체를 찾는 여정이 드디어 성공적인 끝을 맺었습니다

translation.en: We figured it out.
Take that, Lauren Schmidt Hissrich!
Thank you.
In the fourth episode,
there's also this formidable killer insect that haunts Yennefer, roachhound.
translation.ko: 예니퍼를 위협하는 살인 벌레 로치하운드도 등장합니다

translation.en: So we started researching it, and the weirdest thing we realized is…
translation.ko: 그래서 로치하운드를 조사했더니 이상한 점을 발견했어요

translation.en: where are all the insect monsters?
translation.ko: 벌레 괴물은 다 어디 간 거죠?

translation.en: Like, I mean, insects, and all arthropods, really,
are basically already monsters in real life.
So why not make them mythological ones?
But maybe we're not looking in the right places.
translation.ko: 우리가 엉뚱한 곳을 찾고 있었을지도 몰라요

translation.en: Think about it.
The typical Western myths that many of us learn in school
usually involve mammalian or sometimes lizard-like creatures.
translation.ko: 주로 포유류 괴물이 나오고 때론 도마뱀 정도가 나옵니다

translation.en: But Asian, Pacific, and Indigenous folklore
translation.ko: 하지만 아시아, 태평양 지역과 원주민 설화에는

translation.en: often seems to use insects and spiders in their monster making.
translation.ko: 곤충과 거미 괴물이 등장하는 경우가 많아요

translation.en: In the tales of Thailand
and several New York State Native American tribes,
there are monster mosquitoes as big as chickens
who are capable of launching coordinated attacks on forts.
translation.ko: 전략을 세워서 인간 요새를 공격하기도 하죠

translation.en: The Wayana of South America have Kuluwajak,
forgive the pronunciation,
a two-headed caterpillar who cuts off and devours human heads.
translation.ko: 머리가 두 개인 이 애벌레는 인간의 머리를 잘라 먹죠

translation.en: And then there's Japan.
The Japanese have a giant Samurai-hating spider
translation.ko: 일본에는 사무라이를 싫어하고 투명화 능력이 있는

translation.en: that can turn invisible,
and Ōmukade, a mountain-sized centipede with venom for breath.
translation.ko: 독을 내뿜는 산 크기의 지네 오무카데도 있어요

translation.en: By the way, this is a real Mukade centipede,
and I still find it frightening.
So, yeah, insect monsters.
I'm not scared.
Are-- are you scared?
Run far, run fast, Yennefer!
[echoing] There's something profoundly disturbing about meeting your exact twin.
translation.ko: 나랑 똑같이 생긴 사람을 보면 이상하게 기분이 불쾌해요

translation.en: -Wait. -Wait. -Stop that! -Stop that!
Which might be why the myth of the doppelgänger
keeps finding its way into our popular fiction,
translation.ko: 계속 대중문화에 모습을 드러내는 것 같아요

translation.en: including in The Witcher's doppler.
True, the word doppelgänger was only coined in the 18th century,
translation.ko: 물론 '도플갱어'라는 단어는 18세기에나 생겨났지만 "도플갱어 둘씩 존재하는 사람"

translation.en: but cultures as old as the Ancient Egyptians believed in the ka,
a sort of spiritual facsimile
replete with a person's memories and feelings
translation.ko: 사람의 기억과 감정을 공유해 오해를 불러일으키기도 하죠

translation.en: that could sometimes mislead.
translation.ko: 사람의 기억과 감정을 공유해 오해를 불러일으키기도 하죠 "카의 상형문자"

translation.en: But they can also replace you.
Everything you've ever done,
ever debated,
ever dreamed is in our head now.
translation.ko: 품었던 꿈이 이제 우리 머릿속에 있어

translation.en: People from the Orkney Islands feared the trow,
sickly changeling creatures
that would replace healthy human babies with their identical trow replicas.
translation.ko: 자신의 모습을 한 복제본과 바꿔치기하는 녀석들이죠

translation.en: Sometimes a benign version of the doppelgänger will pop up.
The Norse Vardøger, for instance, was an identical you
that went ahead of the real you and showed up early to all your meetings.
translation.ko: 약속 장소에 늦지 않도록 먼저 나타나는 역할을 했죠

translation.en: But most of the time, they're an omen of doom.
Following his election in 1860,
Abraham Lincoln allegedly saw his exact double in the mirror.
translation.ko: 에이브러햄 링컨은 거울에서 자신의 모습을 봤다고 합니다

translation.en: The other was pale and ghastly looking.
translation.ko: 거울 속 자신은 더 창백하고 섬뜩해 보였죠

translation.en: His wife believed the vision foretold his re-election,
translation.ko: 이를 보고 아내는 남편의 재선 혹은 죽음을 예견했습니다

translation.en: but also his death.
translation.ko: 이를 보고 아내는 남편의 재선 혹은 죽음을 예견했습니다 "총에 맞은 링컨, 위독한 상황"

translation.en: There is a condition, heautoscopy,
which can cause someone to see their double at a distance.
translation.ko: 자신의 모습을 한 존재가 자꾸 보이는 병이죠

translation.en: Or, at least, you better hope it's heautoscopy and not a doppelgänger!
translation.ko: 설령 도플갱어를 만났다고 해도 환시라고 믿는 게 좋을 겁니다

translation.en: As hard as it is to believe while watching this,
translation.ko: "서식지: 폐허, 공동묘지, 사막" 이런 장면을 보면 상상하기 힘들지만

translation.en: the djinn of Arabian mythology are, surprisingly, a lot like us.
translation.ko: 아랍 신화에 등장하는 정령은 사실 우리와 비슷합니다

translation.en: I mean, sure, they are technically, according to the Koran,
translation.ko: 물론 다른 점도 있죠 쿠란에 의하면 정령은

translation.en: creatures made of smokeless fire
that live in an unseeable, unknowable dimension somewhere beyond our own,
translation.ko: 볼 수도 없고, 이해할 수도 없는 차원에서 거주하며

translation.en: and who are blessed with supernatural powers
of shape-shifting, invisibility and flight,
but they also possess a fair share of human qualities.
translation.ko: 하지만 인간의 자질도 상당 부분 가지고 있죠

translation.en: Like us, the djinn eat.
They drink. They sleep.
They fall in love or lust with each other and with humans,
as made vividly clear in this pre-Islamic era poem,
translation.ko: 이슬람 시대 이전에 쓰인 이 시에도 적혀 있어요

translation.en: which isn't all that flattering for either side.
And maybe most like us,
translation.ko: "끔찍한 얼굴에 눈은 두 개 기형의 태아 같은 다리" 또 대부분의 인간처럼 선과 악 중에서 선택합니다

translation.en: they're capable of choosing between good and evil,
translation.ko: 또 대부분의 인간처럼 선과 악 중에서 선택합니다

translation.en: although, unfortunately, many seem to end up on the dark side.
translation.ko: 안타깝게도 많은 정령들이 악을 택하고는 하죠

translation.en: Their mischief continues to the present day.
Because while the existence of djinn predates even the founding of Islam,
translation.ko: 정령의 존재는 이슬람 이전에 탄생했지만 "정령을 믿는 인구 비율"

translation.en: belief in them is still very common in many parts of the Muslim world.
translation.ko: 여전히 정령을 믿는 무슬림들이 많기 때문이죠 "모로코 86% 튀니지 79%, 레바논 73%"

translation.en: Djinn can be annoying.
In 2009, a Saudi couple, somehow, sued one for harassment.
It was making weird noises and throwing rocks at their house.
translation.ko: 이상한 소리를 내고 집에 돌을 던졌다는 이유로요

translation.en: On the more serious side,
the djinn are believed to be able to possess humans,
translation.ko: 정령은 인간에게 빙의할 수도 있다고 해요

translation.en: and the psychiatric trauma attributed to djinn possession
translation.ko: 정령 빙의로 인한 심리적 외상이 어찌나 심한지

translation.en: is so serious that I found seemingly dozens of articles
translation.ko: "빙의와 정령" 수많은 기사와 논문을 찾을 수 있었죠

translation.en: and legitimate medical journals about it.
translation.ko: "정령과 정신 건강" "정령 빙의돼 섬망성 조증 걸린 파키스탄 여성"

translation.en: By the way, if you are ever possessed,
Arabic lore suggests you go ahead and put on a necklace of fox or cat teeth
translation.ko: 아랍 설화에 의하면 여우나 고양이 이빨로 목걸이를 만들어 착용해서

translation.en: to frighten the djinn away.
But as with grumpy humans,
maybe the best advice is to just give the djinn their space
translation.ko: 가장 좋은 대처법은 정령을 건드리지 않는 것

translation.en: and never, ever go fishing for them.
translation.ko: 무엇보다 정령 낚시를 하지 않는 겁니다

translation.en: Don't judge me.
Okay, monster maniacs,
those were all the monsters in the first half of The Witcher.
translation.ko: '위쳐' 전반부에 나오는 모든 괴물을 소개해 드렸어요

translation.en: You may notice that Geralt spends a lot of time in bathtubs throughout the show,
translation.ko: 게롤트가 목욕을 얼마나 좋아하는지 다들 아실 겁니다

translation.en: which raised the question, are there bathtub monsters?
Again, Japan comes through.
The Akaname is a strange, dirty, and disgusting little goblin
translation.ko: 아카나메는 더럽고 징그러운 작은 몸집의 도깨비인데

translation.en: that licks the filth off of bathtubs.
translation.ko: 욕조에 묻은 오물을 혀로 핥아 먹는다네요

translation.en: So enjoy your bath tonight!
